Previous PA and lateral chest radiographs ___ and ___ showed identical prominence of the pulmonary outflow tract on the lateral view and fullness in the AP window on the frontal.  However, the pulmonary arteries in both hila are normal size.  This could be due to  enlargement of the pulmonary artery, related to elevated pulmonary artery pressure, abnormal pulmonic valve, or a case it idiopathic pulmonary artery dilatation, or a mediastinal lesion such is a cyst or indolent mass mimicking a dilated pulmonary artery.  CT scanning would be necessary to make that distinction and given the possibility of pulmonary artery enlargement I would recommend a CTA to exclude the possibility of chronic and recurrent pulmonary emboli.  RECOMMENDATION(S)  CTA to exclude the possibility of chronic and recurrent pulmonary emboli.
